text: "Very good! Try the guaco and chips. It was some of the best I've ever had. It's byob so bring some tequila for some good margaritas!"

author: Rohan
text: 'The place is really good. Its small place with amazing food. The best thing is they make guacamole on the table itself. I liked it very much. Service is quick and fast. I tried tacos here they are amazing. Try this place if you love Mexican food. The flan is delicious. The street parking is the only option.'

author: thalia ts
text:
'(Translated by Google) THE MOST RICH POZOLE

(Original)
EL POZOLE RIQUISIMO'

author: Caileigh Fazzini
text: 'Delicious food and great atmosphere. Bathrooms were not clean however'

author: Jennifer Spadavecchia
text: "Love Charrito's!!!! All locations!!"

author: Brian Levitan
text: "My family's favorite place to go on Friday nights!"

author: truly gifted
text: 'best Mexican hands down
column5: margaritas amazing!  guacamole the best'

author: Jacob Fattakhov
text: 'Large portions and great food. Its byob
column5: reccomend bringing teuqila they will turn it into an excellent pitcher of margarita. Outdoor and indoor seating'

author: Samir Shah
text: "We had heard good things about this place from a lot of friends and finally got to try it out the other day. We went on a Thursday evening for dinner so it wasn't super busy and we didn't have to wait to be seated. Food was amazing and ‚Ä¶"

author: Brendan McDermott
text: 'SO GOOD.  Best Mexican in Hoboken.  Try the enchiladas.'

author: Molly Thompson
text: 'Best Mexican food in Hoboken! Love the new location
column5: much more space.'

author: Miranda Datoli
text: 'Great location'

author: Daniel Escalona
text:
'(Translated by Google) Excellent attention

(Original)
Excelente atenci√≥n'

author: Leyla Bascombe
text: 'Its was my moms birthday we went there with family we made the reservation day before. the food was good. They dont sell alcohol but u can bring your bottle with you.'

author: Tim Zheng
text: '$15 for three tiny Tacos. The taste worths $5.'

author: William Friedman
text: 'Great food and atmosphere. Freshly made guacamole tableside
column5: great service
column6: amazing food. Definitely a go to spot for Spanish cuisine in Hoboken.'

author: Varun nair
text: 'Best place for Mexican food'

author: Mah Rezaa
text: 'Great food but service was below par. Chile Relleno with chicken is tasty.'

author: Mehul Vora
text: 'Decent food although very limited options on the menu . The chicken enchiladas were really good.'

author: Josefina Camela
text: '(Translated by Google) Because they only give a limited act for each person and the attention takes a long time ‚Ä¶'

author: Alex Harding
text: 'This is the Charritos that is not vegetarian
column5: thankfully. The food is solid (from my Texan standards) and the service is good. The best part (I think) is that if you bring them a bottle of tequila they will mix up a pitcher of margaritas for you at your table. Also check out the tableside guac!'

author: Rahul Nagardalekar
text: 'I loved the guacamole and chips as guacamole was freshly made at the table. They bring all ingredients to your table and then make it as you want. ‚Ä¶'

author: Iram Lazo
text: 'The food taste great! And the staff very friendly.'

author: Saloni Jiwan
text: 'My absolute favorite place for Mexican food!'

author: Ashutosh Sharma
text: 'Decent  food...good staff'

author: Angelika Sharma
text: 'Food as good as the other Charritos in Weehawken
column5: however the service could not have been more slow. Even when we waved with both arms we were ignored
column6: as were the tables next to us. They did make Sangria for us from the red wine we brought

author: William Kressner
text: 'This place is excellent. Bottom line. I had las flautas and they were very well done. The flautas themselves were warm and crispy and the chicken was very tender. It came with a bit guacamole that was very fresh (they prepare it table side) ‚Ä¶'

author: Chirag Trivedi
text: 'Good food options and nice atmosphere. Excellent service
column5: slower than usual
column6: but on busy days it is to be expected.'

author: vipin kv
text: 'Worth a shot !!!'

author: Pack My Bag Please
text: 'Love the chicken burritos here! Also the freshly table-made Guac!!'

author: James Provence
text: 'Amazing fajitas'

author: Shiva Patel
text: 'No vegetarian options and were told to go to the downtown location if that was a dietary need.'

author: Suzanne Griffiths
text: 'Food and service were amazing!'

author: Erika Olivares
text: '(Translated by Google) Delicious food and very good service. I go about 2 times a month and whenever I go the waiters are very attentive and always taste good. ‚Ä¶'

author: Elisa Borowski
text: "The place is much bigger than it looks from the outside. They have a back room and an upstairs. It's BYOB but if you bring your tequila they will make you some good margaritas. The rim was delicious. It had a nice spice to it. The guacamole ‚Ä¶"

author: Cristina Herrera
text: 'Really good Mexican food my husband loved the tortilla soup'

author: Matthew Jones
text: 'Great food and fun atmosphere. Pretty lively place on Friday nights. Friendly staff and authentic Mexican food.'

author: JP
text: "I sat at the bar and ordered the sopa de tortilla (tortilla soup). Service was sub-par. They weren't friendly
column5: weren't mean
column6: just kind of...there. Soup comes out. I took one bite and it was inedible. The chilis were unpleasantly bitter. I ‚Ä¶"

author: Andrew Monshizadeh
text: 'Wonderfully tasty food with really fun guacamole.'

author: Andy Becker
text: 'Hoping it was just the holidays but uptown location closed permanently . No fajitas at midtown location. Then what I did order was just so so. Please fix. The uptown location did some dishes well please bring to midtown and bring that uptown menu with you.'

author: Norma Rodrigues
text: 'We loved this new location of charritos. Great work at the interiors. Three food was amazing exchange location.'

author: Tanya Torres
text: 'Love this place. Authentic Mexican food at reasonable prices. I gave it a four star because it gets quite packed and you may have to wait a while before getting seated. Overall its a very chilled place. *BYOB =)'

author: Nate Chertack
text: 'I found the tacos to be very authentic. Service was fast and friendly.'

author: Nickitas Georgas
text: 'Tasty guacamole cut fresh at the table. Good food
column5: small tavern-like selection. Authentic looking decoration.'

author: Chris Shimmin
text: 'Food was good
column5: not great. BYOB which is a plus.'

author: Christina Attardo Jordan
text: "Food was average
column5: service barely average. Different menu than the other locations. All of it grossly overpriced! $6 for a small side of rice and beans? $4 for a Coke? No way. Oh and if you want to wait at the (empty) bar for your table to be ready? You're actually going to forfeit your table
column6: FYI"
